sources.title: MURDER BY TELEVISION (1935)
sources.description: A scientist collapses while demonstrating his new television machine. Bela Lugosi stars in this great who dun-it. Produced by Cameo Pictures.

sources.title: Murder by Television (1935)
sources.description: James Houghland, inventor of a new method by which television signals can be instantaneously sent anywhere in the world, refuses to sell the process to television companies, who then send agents to acquire the invention any way they can. On the night of his initial broadcast Houghland is mysteriously murdered in the middle of his demonstration and it falls to Police Chief Nelson to determine who the murderer is from the many suspects present. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/murder-by-television-1935/

sources.title: 1935 - Murder by Television - Double Bela Lugosi cracks a "death ray" riddle
sources.description:
When live TV's inventor drops dead on-air, a mansion of suspects faces a static-filled whodunit.
Visionary James Houghland  refuses to sell his global broadcast tech, but dies mysteriously during the premiere transmission. With corporate spies circling and a detective hunting clues, twin FBI agent Arthur Perry must untangle signals from lies.

Alternative title: The Houghland Murder Case (1935)
Colorized version: https://youtu.be/a1apD5HA7OI

Director: Clifford Sanforth
Writers: Joseph O'Donnell, Clarence Hennecke, Karl R. Coolidge
Stars: Bela Lugosi, Hattie McDaniel, June Collyer, Huntley Gordon

Genres: Mystery, Thriller, Sci-Fi
Release date: October 1, 1935
Filming location: Hollywood, Los Angeles, California

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

@CultCinemaClassics

sources.title: Murder by Television (1935) BELA LUGOSI
sources.description:
Stars: Bela Lugosi, June Collyer, Huntley Gordon 
Director: Clifford Sanforth

The inventor of a new method by which television signals can be instantaneously sent anywhere in the world, refuses to sell the process to television companies. On the night of his initial demonstration broadcast, the inventor is mysteriously murdered and it falls to the Police Chief to uncover who the murderer is from the many suspects present!

metadata.Plot: James Houghland, inventor of a new method by which television signals can be instantaneously sent anywhere in the world, refuses to sell the process to television companies, who then send agents to acquire the invention any way they can. On the night of his initial broadcast Houghland is mysteriously murdered in the middle of his demonstration and it falls to Police Chief Nelson to determine who the murderer is from the many suspects present.
